title: Ancient Roman Terms
description: Journey to the Roman Empire and learn the words that shaped Western civilization

questions.question: In ancient Rome, what was the 'Forum'?
options: The central public space used for commerce, politics, and socializing

questions.question: What was a Roman 'consul'?
options: One of two chief magistrates elected annually to lead the Republic

questions.question: In Roman society, what was a 'plebeian'?
options: A common citizen, as opposed to the aristocratic patricians

questions.question: What was a 'toga' in ancient Rome?
options: A draped outer garment worn by Roman citizens

questions.question: In Roman architecture, what was an 'aqueduct'?
options: A structure built to carry water over long distances
A type of bridge for armies

questions.question: What did 'veni, vidi, vici' mean?
options: I came, I saw, I conquered

questions.question: In ancient Rome, what was a 'centurion'?
What was the 'Senate' in Roman government?
options: The assembly of elder statesmen who advised on policy and law

questions.question: In ancient Rome, what was a 'gladiator'?
options: A trained fighter who battled in arenas for public entertainment

questions.question: What did 'pax' mean in Roman Latin?
In Roman culture, what was a 'triumph'?
options: A ceremonial procession granted to a victorious general

questions.question: What was a 'villa' in ancient Rome?
options: A large country estate or house

questions.question: In Roman law, what did 'habeas corpus' literally mean?
options: You shall have the body (to be brought before a court)

questions.question: What was a Roman 'legion'?
options: The main unit of the Roman army, typically 4,000-6,000 soldiers

questions.question: In ancient Rome, what were the 'Ides' (as in 'Ides of March')?
options: The 15th day of March, May, July, and October in the Roman calendar
